intro: Lycianthes tricolor var. hirsutior, commonly known as the hairy three-color nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically yellow with purple veins. It produces small, orange or yellow fruits that are edible but often have a bitter taste. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and unique appearance.
